meanings.definition: A garment worn on the legs and feet, typically covering from the toes to the knees.
meanings.sent1: She put on her stookings before going out in the cold.
meanings.sent2: The dancer's stookings matched her dress perfectly.
meanings.sent3: In the play, the character mistakenly wore stookings with sandals, causing laughter in the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her stookings were like cozy blankets hugging her legs.
meanings.sent5: The colorful stookings stood out in the sea of plain socks.

meanings.definition: The act of putting on stookings.
meanings.sent1: Her quick stookings made her ready for the chilly weather.
meanings.sent2: The morning routine included the careful stookings of each family member.
meanings.sent3: He performed a comical dance while doing the stookings, entertaining his friends.
meanings.sent4: The stookings of determination helped her face the challenges ahead.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, she completed the stookings and was off to work.

meanings.sent1: She bought a new pair of stookings for the winter season.
meanings.sent2: The store offered a discount on matching stookings for twins.
meanings.sent3: The lost stookings turned up in the most unexpected place - the fridge!
meanings.sent4: His lucky stookings seemed to bring him good fortune wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The fancy stookings were the envy of all her friends at the party.
